nodes.gloss: The strips that run between the legs and connects to the surface (seat)
a soft bag filled with air or a mass of padding such as feathers or foam rubber etc.
a cushion to support the head of a sleeping person
undefined
any support where you can sit (especially the part of a chair or bench etc. on which you sit); "he dusted off the seat before sitting down"
mechanical devices which use the power of compressed gas to produce a force in a reciprocating linear motion.
a rigid bar pivoted about a fulcrum
a sheet of metal or wood or glass or plastic
a round handle
The gas lift mechanism allows the user to adjust the chair to the preferred, ergonomically correct position.
a coupling (as in a chain) that has one end that turns on a headed pin
a support resembling a pedal extremity; "one foot of the chair was on the carpet"
a sheet of metal or wood or glass or plastic
All of the pieces of a caster minus the wheel. Example: top plate, ball bearings, upper race, lower race, fork legs, rivet/kingpin, lock nut, axle.
support consisting of a radial member of a wheel joining the hub to the rim
the central part of a car wheel (or fan or propeller etc) through which the shaft or axle passes
cap that fits over the hub of a wheel
the outer part of a wheel to which the tire is attached
a simple machine consisting of a circular frame with spokes (or a solid disc) that can rotate on a shaft or axle (as in vehicles or other machines)
a restraint used to slow or stop a vehicle
a pivoting roller attached to the bottom of furniture or trucks or portable machines to make them movable
one of the supports for a piece of furniture
swivel base with a star shape
undefined
horizontal support element joining the legs
a support resembling a pedal extremity; "one foot of the chair was on the carpet"
a sheet of metal or wood or glass or plastic
All of the pieces of a caster minus the wheel. Example: top plate, ball bearings, upper race, lower race, fork legs, rivet/kingpin, lock nut, axle.

a support or foundation; "the base of the lamp"
A cylindrically symmetric shaft, usually made of wood.
horizontal bar (usually of wood or metal)
a slat of wood in the middle of the back of a straight chair
outside vertical framing member (of the back)
a rest for the head
a soft bag filled with air or a mass of padding such as feathers or foam rubber etc.
a support that you can lean against while sitting; "the back of the dental chair was adjustable"
Part that supports your elbow and forearm
The upright piece which supports the arm
the part of an armchair or sofa that supports the elbow and forearm of a seated person

gloss: furniture that is designed for sitting on; "there were not enough seats for all the guests"

a simple machine consisting of a circular frame with spokes (or a solid disc) that can rotate on a shaft or axle (as in vehicles or other machines)
a restraint used to slow or stop a vehicle

one of the supports for a piece of furniture
a curved support that permits the supported object to rock to and fro

All of the pieces of a caster minus the wheel. Example: top plate, ball bearings, upper race, lower race, fork legs, rivet/kingpin, lock nut, axle.
